Row.Text: I am Momochi Tamba, who speaks for the people of Iga. I believe it is time we made ourselves known.
This is Iga Province, ruled by no lord. I, Momochi Tamba, greet you on behalf of the Council.
I am grateful to meet you in person. I am Momochi Tamba, of Iga Province.
I have no desire for vengeance. Evil is its own punishment.
To rule is to carry a mountain. Your greatest struggles still lie ahead.
Oh, is there more?
Then, I will persevere as your host.
Isn't it about time you were leaving?
Perhaps I have not made myself clear.
In my shoes, would you accept a deal such as this?
I am pleased to greet you once again.
Welcome back. I will inform the Council of your return.
The roads are dangerous at night.
Why has the brutal lord come to Iga?
It was foolish to think you could walk into our home.
Come, my friend. There is truth in sake.
Ever insatiable is your appetite for bloodshed.
Welcome back. If you wish to hire mercenaries, the men of Iga may be willing to oblige.
I see subtlety is not your greatest strength.
A wise hawk hides his talons.
Do not think we cannot force your expansion back, if necessary.
Borders have long meant little to our people.
Your aggressive purchase of land is quite typical of a rapacious lord.
Borders have long meant little to our people.
Well-trained foot soldiers such as yours could face down almost any foe.
With such wealth at your disposal, you could hire every mercenary in Iga Province.
Iga is no vast empire, but next to your domain we rule the world.
I see almost no soldiers among your ranks. Perhaps they are better at concealment than warfare.
Think very carefully before turning your blood-stained sword on Iga.
True friends are made in harship. Our domains stand a better chance if they stand together.
Iga has enemies, but your domain need not be one of them. Will you join us in a Declaration of Friendship?
The Council has decided to offer you a Declaration of Friendship. Should you accept, then the men of Iga would be at your disposal.
For now, Iga remains alone and hidden. It is too soon for things to change.
Iga's friendship is strong, but hard-won. Perhaps in time you will prove yourself a favourable partner.
The lord of {1_CivName} eyes our two realms with envious eyes. Let us denounce their bloodlust before it begins.
Good medicine is bitter in the mouth. You must change your ways.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
To continue as you are is not strength. It is the path to ruin.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I fear the other lords will show little concern.
The mad ramblings of a deluded lord.
We have worked with {1_CivName}'s lord many times. You will find them an amiable partner.
The vile lord of {1_CivName} shows as little regard for their friends as they do their enemies.
{1_CivName} is no threat to you. If your relations continue to degrade, Iga will be forced to choose sides.
The brutal lord of {1_CivName} is a threat to stability and peace. We agree that their ambition must be reigned in.
The Council has decided to follow your example, and so we have sent a diplomatic mission to the lord of {1_CivName}.
{1_CivName} has made clear their designs on Iga, and the world. The Council has decided to join in your denunciation of them.
Not one, but two bloodthirsty lords. It is a pity you cannot forsee {1_CivName}'s betrayal.
Iga has sworn to protect {1_CivName}. To insult them, is to insult us.
Do you feel as though you have the advantage? Our way of warfare thrives on such hubris.
Naturally, Iga intelligence-gathering could not miss your military position.
Your expansion draws ever closer. Be careful, or your next sip of sake may be your last.
Iga has no love of conquest, but in return we expect not to be encroached upon.
This land cannot be bought for your personal fiefdom. If you declare that it is yours, you must fight for it.
It is unseemly to waste gold for such meager gains.
Lord {1_PlayerName:textkey} threatens not just the people of Iga, but your people as well. We must attack while the advantage is ours.
The continuous conquests of Lord {1_PlayerName:textkey} can no longer be permitted. I'm sure you will agree.
Unless we act, Lord {1_PlayerName:textkey} will unify the world under their own brutal hegemony!
Minor realsm such as {1_MinorCivName:textkey} should be left in peace. Do you not agree?
I must refuse, again.
If you insist.
This is Iga Province. Our home.
I couldn't help but notice how pathetic you are. And when I realized it I couldn't help but share.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
I thought you might like to know that your army is a little on the weak side. Better watch your back.
With an army so weak it's a surprise your empire hasn't succumb to a barbarian invasion.
Our words are backed with nuclear weapons!
It's a shame there are some leaders in this world who have their fun by picking on the weak. Don't you agree?
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It's come to my attention that your empire appears to be quite puny. Did you forget to expand your borders or are you just having a little trouble with that?
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
What a sad sight... your empire is so uncultured. What do your citizens do all day, beat rocks together?
Rumor has it that your culture is so laughable that even the barbarians are shying away from your lands.
We would like to discuss a fair exchange of goods.
Though borders mean little to us, we would like to formalize an Open Borders agreement.
Please, at least show me something the Council has a small chance of accepting.
Trade is not our top priority, but perhaps we might be able to accomodate you.
This is not an equal exchange.
Is this what it has come to? So be it.
How reckless.
Naturally, our intelligence knew of your plans before they were even concieved.
It is about time the men of Iga show you why they are so feared.
Let us drop the pretense of peace.
With many, small strokes, the terrible oak of your rule will be felled.
I would prefer to see you poisoned at your dinner table, but we will adopt this method for now.
We will not simply accept such aggressive acts.
It is unfortunate that a peaceful agreement could not be achieved.
For now, we have nothing to discuss.
There will be peace, but first there will be punishment for your transgressions.
A reckless gambit by a foolish lord.
Our people are now nowhere to be seen. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are attending ninja school and doing their ninja homework. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
